channel.title: Apple music connect problems
channel.description: I've been trying to change my pfp and some other things on my profile on Apple Music, so I first requested access to Apple Music Connect and was verified(but somehow they didn't contact me that I was verified, I just checked back on the status one day and it said verified). So I figured I now had access, but I can't figure out how to manage my profile since I don't even have a subscription to Apple Music, but my music is on it(because of Amuse). Do you guys know what to do? (sorry if the question and explanation seems a bit confusing)

item.title: Apple music connect problems
item.dc:creator: anon73773654
item.description:
Idk.

Problem is, I actually emailed Apple artist support asking if, once the beta releases, we’ll be able to change our profile photos. They responded saying no, and that we should contact our distributor about profile photos. My distributor is Amuse… except, Amuse support are the ones who emailed me saying that Apple Music changes your pfp.

Totally contradicting statements. Emailing them back about it. :\

Read full topic

item.title: Apple music connect problems

item.description:
Yo that’s what I did! It just I didn’t get that verification for your reserved spot…

Read full topic

item.title: Apple music connect problems
item.dc:creator: DJC
item.description:
I don’t remember exactly, but it took at least three weeks or longer(long enough for me to stop caring about it). And then I checked back in with my apple ID and found that the status was verified, but it didn’t tell me how I could actually access my music or even send a notification.

Read full topic

item.title: Apple music connect problems
item.dc:creator: anon73773654
item.description:
Just found out you can also get verified on Google Play and Shazam. Wouldn’t recommend Google Play though… website says it costs $25 to set up one artist page.

Read full topic

item.title: Apple music connect problems
item.dc:creator: anon73773654
item.description:
I just emailed Amuse about this, as @NickElle had just suggested. They got back to me saying that iTunes manages this for you, and you do it by getting verified via this site. https://artists.apple.com/

Amuse also made an article to help you with getting verified on different sites. https://support.amuse.io/hc/en-us/articles/115005773029-Artist-Profile-in-the-stores

You do need an Apple ID, but I’m pretty sure all of us have one. xD

All you need to do is fill out the form, which asks for your role, business email, phone number, profile links, etc. They also ask for Label/Management Contact. I was about to submit Amuse’s contact info, but it said on Amuse’s article for verification that, if you don’t have a label/manager, just copy your own contact info into that slot. And that’s what I did.

Just submitted my request to get verified. I’ll let you guys know when it happens.

Read full topic

item.title: Apple music connect problems

item.description:
@NickElle i hadn’t requested it yet. I will do that now. Thanks for reminding me.

Read full topic

item.title: Apple music connect problems
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
Did anyone answer the question?

If not, go to amuse.io and look for an email address.
Tell them that you would like to add your profile picture to Apple Music and iTunes.
See what they say.

Read full topic

item.title: Apple music connect problems
item.dc:creator: darwinmcd
item.description:
@akabillposters I applied and kind of forgot about it (not really pushing listeners to Apple very hard), but I believe it was at least a few weeks before I got the email that I had been verified.

item.title: Apple music connect problems
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
+ @DJC

How long did it take to get into Apple Music for Artists?
I’ve had tracks on there for a few weeks and applied for AMfA as soon as they appeared, but I’m still pending.

I’m not concerned, just wondering.

Read full topic

item.title: Apple music connect problems
item.dc:creator: darwinmcd
item.description:
Same boat here. I was verified for the Apple Music for Artists (Beta) web tool. I logged in and can see all the metrics for my songs - streams, purchases, etc. (which is pretty useful), but there is nowhere for you to manage your artist profile picture (mine is currently the cover art for one of my songs). I wrote to Apple’s ArtistHelp and here is the response I got:

So I suppose we’d have to reach out to Amuse to do this?

Also, to get access, you need to set up an ITunes Connect account and then link that to your artist profile. Since you’re verified, sounds like you already did that?

Here is the link to the Apple Music for Artists Beta website. Try logging in there with your Apple ID and see if you can get in.

https://itunesconnect.apple.com/login?module=ArtistConnect&hostname=artists.apple.com

Read full topic

item.title: Apple music connect problems

item.description:

Read full topic
